data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Cleanup of interactive markers (#101)

* Use the tf2_geometry_msgs target.

This should allow us to avoid hard-coded paths on Windows, and
is the modern CMake way to do things.

* Add in missing dependencies.

These were "hidden" dependencies, but they should be explicit.

* Make sure to include-what-you-use everywhere.

* Use std::string constref everywhere we can.

This should be more efficient than the copy.

* Get rid of unnecessary (and sometimes dangerous) using statements.

* Use constref for exception types.

* Switch to size_t for iterations over container types.

* Move get_interactive_markers to a cpp file.

That way it could be included more than once.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@gmail.com>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Update interactive_markers to C++17. (#99)

The main reason to do this is so that we can compile interactive_markers
with the clang static analyzer.  As of clang++-14 (what is in
Ubuntu 22.04), the default still seems to be C++14, so we need
to specify C++17 so that new things in the rclcpp headers work
properly.

Further, due to reasons I don't fully understand, I needed to
set CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED in order for clang to really use
that version.  So set this as well.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Jacob Perron
data.message:
Do not publish if context is invalid during shutdown (#89)

* Do not publish if context is invalid during shutdown

Fixes #88.

If shutdown is called and the ROS context is invalid, then we should avoid publishing changes.
Also, call the relevant destroy methods for entities created using the node.

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Minor refactor of shutdown

* Only call clear if broadcasting change
* Guard against passing None to destroy methods

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Jacob Perron
data.message:
Port Python implementation to ROS 2 (#53)

* Move Python files to their own directory

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Install Python via ament_cmake_python

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Make Python implementation ROS 2 compatible

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Use docstrings

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Minor refactor of callback logic

* Guard against None values and KeyError's
* Change insert() signature to take keyword arguments
* Rename variables for clarity (e.g. 'cb' -> 'callback')

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Fix PEP 257 errors

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Remove unused setup.py

We're installing the Python package with CMake instead.

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Enable flake8 tests and fix errors

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Improve performance

Remove a debug log statement that was causing a severe performance degradation if there are many
poses to update.
Also, change the depth setting of the feedback subscription to 1. Otherwise, we see latency
if there are many feedback messages arriving.

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Fix bugs

* Clear pending updates after applying all of them
* Don't rely on user to apply any pose updates

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Expose feedback depth as parameter

And make the depth parameters keyword arguments for clarity.

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Make full QoSProfile a parameter instead of just depth

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Fix comparison

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Add Python implementation dependencies to package.xml

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Fix lint

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Jacob Perron
data.message:
Port to ROS 2 (#44)

* Rename headers
Now with .hpp suffix

* Add linter tests

* Uncrustify

* Lint

* Do not run flake8 linter test

* Add LICENSE and CONTRIBUTING.md
This satisfies the ament_copyright linter.

* Fix deprecation warning

* Use rcutils log macro instead of custom macro

* Use tf2::BufferCoreInterface
Using this abstract interface enables use of the interactive marker client with other buffer implementations.
Also, switched to using shared pointers to avoid potential dangling reference.

* Replace 'init' topic with a ROS service
It seems more intuitive for clients to call a service to get the latest state for interactive
markers, versus subscribing to a latched topic and waiting for the server to publish.

* Add tests for InteractiveMarkerServer

* Add getter for client state
Useful for introspection, especially during testing.

* Add tests for InteractiveMarkerClient

* Merge SingleClient logic into InteractiveMarkerClient.
 Now it is assumed that there is maximum one server per client.
 This helps simplify the implementation.

* Update doc-block comment style

* Renaming of variables for clarity

* Remove old test code and unused single_client.hpp

* Refactor tools docs

* Remove notion of server ID

* Refactor interactive marker client docs

* Update copyright license

* Make shared library

* Add feedback publisher to client

* Implement client request timeout

If a response for the request isn't received within the provided timeout, then try again.

* Add logic for 'extrapolation into future' error

Rename custom exception and throw it in replace of tf2 exceptions.

* Default to C++14 and set stricter compiler flags
Fix compiler warnings

* Fix Windows compiler warnings

* Remove StateMachine class
The functionality it provided is not needed.

* Fix Clang warnings

* Move message context header into same directory as other headers

* Use visibility macros

data.author: Simon Schmeisser
data.message:
fix crash when updates arrives/is processed while shutdown is called (#36)

* fix crash when updates arrives/is processed while shutdown is called

SingleClient is stored in a shared pointer, but this shared pointer was actually never shared
with anybody. So clearing the map will simply delete all instances of SingleClient even if used
in a process call

* use CATKIN_ENABLE_TESTING instead of GTEST_FOUND

* No longer need travis-ci

* Fix unittest failing due to new quaternion tests

state_machine.h: fix initialization of state_, chg_time_

data.author: Max Schwarz
data.message:
state_machine.h: fix initialization of state_, chg_time_

The old code called operator=() to initialize, which checked
state_ to determine whether a change was really needed. Of course,
at that point in time state_ was still uninitialized. So do the
initialization explicitly.

Found using valgrind.

data.author: David Gossow
data.message:
Merge pull request #25 from xqms/fix-shutdown-segfault

InteractiveMarkerClient: harden callback code against shutdown()

data.author: Max Schwarz
data.message:
InteractiveMarkerClient: harden callback code against shutdown()

The user-supplied callback called by SingleClient might actually call
InteractiveMarkerClient::shutdown() (rviz does this). In that case,
we delete the SingleClient which is doing the current call, which
leads to memory corruption when we return to it.

Changes:
 1) Explicitly keep a reference to the current SingleClient being update()d
 2) Detect that the client map was cleared by the callback and stop
    iterating

Found using valgrind.

data.author: Mike Koval
data.message: Replaced silent failure with an assertion.

data.author: Mike Koval
data.message:
Fixed a SEGFAULT in setPose reported in #18

Previously, calling setPose() on an interactive marker causes a SEGFAULT
if applyChanges() was not called on the server at least once since the
marker was created. I traced the actual SEGFAULT to the doSetPose
function. The value of header passed from setPose() is invalid because,
in this case, marker_context_it = marker_contexts_.end().

I added a check for this case and, if there is no marker is present,
instead use the header from the pending update.

data.author: Dave Hershberger
data.message:
interactive_markers: fixed bug 5081, multiple server initialization bug.  Now every server sends an init message when it starts up (in constructor) even if there are no markers to send.  This way the keepalive messages which it *also* sends do not erase the display.

git-svn-id: https://code.ros.org/svn/ros-pkg/stacks/visualization/trunk@37666 eb33c2ac-9c88-4c90-87e0-44a10359b0c3

data.author: Dave Hershberger
data.message:
rviz and interactive_markers: fixed bug #5021 by changing the INIT protocol and logic.  Added unit test to rviz of new class implementing the logic (InteractiveMarkerClient).  This commit also fixes #5032 in interactive_markers, by splitting insert() into two functions: one which adds a callback and one which doesn't.

git-svn-id: https://code.ros.org/svn/ros-pkg/stacks/visualization/trunk@37373 eb33c2ac-9c88-4c90-87e0-44a10359b0c3
